title: Paralowie: Man falls through roof after pursuit
text:
A man has been arrested after falling through a carport roof while allegedly trying to run away from police overnight.

The string of dramatic events first started on Semaphore Rd in Semaphore just after 12.30am today.

Police tried to stop a Ford sedan driving without its headlights on, but the man behind the wheel allegedly sped off towards Victoria Rd.

A police helicopter took over the pursuit, tracking it through Henley Beach and onto the Port River Expressway.

It was eventually spiked on Port Wakefield Rd in Paralowie.

media_camera Scroll down to follow all the morning's breaking news.

The car continued to drive with two spiked tyres, but the 26-year-old man from Davoren Park soon gave up, allegedly running away through nearby backyards instead.

Police say he climbed onto a roof of a house before he fell through the carport.

He was arrested in the backyard of a house on Boyara Cr after a short struggle.

He was refused bail to appear in the Elizabeth Magistrates Court today, where he will face several charges including carrying an offensive weapon and driving disqualified.
